channel.title: Talks By Dean L. Larsen
channel.description: General Conference talks by Dean L. Larsen.

item.title: “I Am the Vine, Ye Are the Branches”
item.description: This past week, as I read through some prospective material for the magazine, I came to these lines of verse that reflect the reaction of a housewife after her first encounter with some Latter-day Saint missionaries:

item.title: Faith, Courage, and Making Choices
item.description: I would like to speak to the young men of the Aaronic Priesthood about faith and courage and about making choices. I hope what I say will help you to face the special challenges you will be required to meet in your maturing years.

item.title: Self-Accountability and Human Progress
item.description: My comments today will bear upon President Kimball’s challenge to us to rise above the plateaus we have been on. They will relate also to the added flexibility and freedom we are being encouraged to assume in the new pattern of Sunday worship and wee

item.title: The Strength of the Kingdom Is Within
item.description: On one occasion a group of Pharisees confronted the Savior and demanded to know when the kingdom of God would come upon the earth. (See .) Their tradition had taught them that God’s kingdom would be impressive in its demonstration of power and in its

item.title: A Royal Generation
item.description: Tonight in this meeting of the priesthood, we will be talking about the importance of families. Other matters of importance will also be discussed, but special attention will be given to families. The more we learn about the power of the influence ex

item.title: Coordination and Cooperation
item.description: It’s a marvelous thing to see this tabernacle filled with sisters and then to realize that tens of thousands of others are met in centers throughout the country to participate in this most notable meeting. We realize also that through the recordings

item.title: “By Their Fruits Ye Shall Know Them”
item.description: In recent months, several items of historical interest have surfaced in one way or another, stirring a renewed interest in the life of Joseph Smith and the means through which he established the Church. A wide range of opinions has been expressed reg

item.title: Looking beyond the Mark
item.description: When I was a young man, I enjoyed participating in athletic activities of various kinds. I was never very expert in these things, but this did not diminish my interest nor the satisfaction that came from my participation. I was particularly intereste

item.title: Winding Up Our Spiritual Clocks
item.description: Since the announcement yesterday of the change of status of some of the members of the Seventies quorums, I have been trying to think of words that might appropriately pay tribute to these good men. I’ve concluded that words are inadequate and that i

item.title: “Beware Lest Thou Forget the Lord”
item.description: We welcome the Brethren whom you have sustained this morning as new members of the Seventies Quorums. They are men of faith and devotion with a broad background of experience in Church leadership. Their call is a reflection of the continuing growth o

item.title: The Lord Will Prosper the Righteous
item.description: In behalf of the Presidency of the Seventy and the Quorum members, I would like to express a very warm welcome to Elders Eyring and Pace as they take their place now among the ranks of the Seventy. We also acknowledge the addition to the Seventies Qu
